block.p: Nancy Burstyn Kaufman, a daughter of Sharon B. Green and a stepdaughter of Peter J. Green of Manhattan, was married last evening to Michael Ian Okun, a son of Alane and William A. Okun of Harrison, N.Y. Rabbi Joel S. Goor officiated at the University Club in Manhattan.

Mrs. Okun, 25, is studying to become a veterinary technician at La Guardia Community College in Long Island City, Queens. She graduated from Syracuse University. Her stepfather retired as the president of Cotton City Industries, a former maker of women's clothing in Manhattan.

Nancy Burstyn Kaufman, a daughter of Sharon B. Green and a stepdaughter of Peter J. Green of Manhattan, was married last evening to Michael Ian Okun, a son of Alane and William A. Okun of Harrison, N.Y. Rabbi Joel S. Goor officiated at the University Club in Manhattan.

Nancy Burstyn Kaufman, a daughter of Sharon B. Green and a stepdaughter of Peter J. Green of Manhattan, was married last evening to Michael Ian Okun, a son of Alane and William A. Okun of Harrison, N.Y. Rabbi Joel S. Goor officiated at the University Club in Manhattan.

Mrs. Okun, 25, is studying to become a veterinary technician at La Guardia Community College in Long Island City, Queens. She graduated from Syracuse University. Her stepfather retired as the president of Cotton City Industries, a former maker of women's clothing in Manhattan.

Mr. Okun, also 25, is a director for commercial leasing at the Hunter Realty Organization, a brokerage in Manhattan. He graduated from Lafayette College in Easton, Pa. His father is a partner in Newman & Okun, a law firm in Manhattan.
